original_solution_mapping.L1: Since each student needs 10 cups of water per day and there are 200 students, the custodian has to provide 200*10 = <<200*10=2000>>2000 cups of water.
original_solution_mapping.L2: A jug of water needs 40 cups to be full, so 2000 cups of water will fill 2000/40 = <<2000/40=50>>50 jugs

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2128.
    Returns: the number of water jugs the custodian will fill.
    """
    # L1
    students = 200 # 200 students
    cups_per_student = 10 # 10 cups of water
    total_cups_needed = students * cups_per_student

    # L2
    cups_per_jug = 40 # 40 cups of water
    num_jugs = total_cups_needed / cups_per_jug

    # FA
    answer = num_jugs
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Since each student needs {cups_per_student} cups of water per day and there are {students} students, the custodian has to provide {students}*{cups_per_student} = <<{students}*{cups_per_student}={total_cups_needed}>>{total_cups_needed} cups of water.

A jug of water needs {cups_per_jug} cups to be full, so {total_cups_needed} cups of water will fill {total_cups_needed}/{cups_per_jug} = <<{total_cups_needed}/{cups_per_jug}={num_jugs}>>{num_jugs} jugs

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Since each student needs 200 cups of water per day and there are 200 students, the custodian has to provide 200*200 = <<200*200=40000>>40000 cups of water.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: A jug of water needs 40 cups to be full, so 40000 cups of water will fill 40000/40 = <<40000/40=1000>>1000 jugs

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'students' (200) was used instead of 'cups_per_student' (10).
